TopicTitle: [1.0.X]Engineering Based Tech Tree (with flight first option)

Articles.Content: I've started another playtest before I add more parts and noticed the problem you guys mentioned when you don't load FASA. I will set about fixing it.

I been playing with this for a while now. And it makes progression quite intresting.

However, I am wondering if this is working as intended... some (just a few) nodes appear to be empty. A few others had parts in them but costed me zero science to unlock. Bug? Or did I mess something up during installation?

Also, despite beeing fairly advanced in the tree now, I am still missing some 1.25 meters tank in a long version. I only have the shorts. Not a big issue, but it makes me wonder if I am missing some other parts in the tree as well maybe...

Edited August 24, 2014 by TrooperCooper

I been playing with this for a while now. And it makes progression quite intresting.

However, I am wondering if this is working as intended... some (just a few) nodes appear to be empty. A few others had parts in them but costed me zero science to unlock. Bug? Or did I mess something up during installation?

Also, despite beeing fairly advanced in the tree now, I am still missing some 1.25 meters tank in a long version. I only have the shorts. Not a big issue, but it makes me wonder if I am missing some other parts in the tree as well maybe...

You are missing the 1.25 branch for some reason.?. I've just uploaded another rev with a few more parts. Use that tech tree instead and your problem should go away.

There may be blank nodes depending on which mods you are playing with. The only nodes (4) that should cost 0 are at the very beginning. Those are there for development and will go away once the tree is released.

Thanks for the feedback!

You are missing the 1.25 branch for some reason.?. I've just uploaded another rev with a few more parts. Use that tech tree instead and your problem should go away.

Yup, that fixed it. 1.25 nodes are there now. Thanks.

Why do I "need to build the "KWright" Flyer to progress".

Is this trying to be another BTSM?
Just a challenge to get you started. Not at all like BTSM.
So with new versions of KSPI (Lite) and B9 released in the last few days, how much more work does that give you?

So with new versions of KSPI (Lite) and B9 released in the last few days, how much more work does that give you?

Now that's a question and a half! I am going to try to integrate them, but it will be tricky to do it well. I am guessing I will need a whole new branch of the tree just for the additional B9 mods alone.
Will you put the new sci-fi parts in separate branches or integrate them according to technologies?

Am I missing something with the KWright Flyer? Seems that node doesn't have any actual propulsion parts... the first Firespitter propellers are in the next node.

Why hasn't anyone else mentioned this?

I've also noticed that FAR doesn't play well with Firespitter, resulting in biplanes easily breaking the sound barrier.

I'd very much like a flight-first tech tree that doesn't rely on Firespitter.

Edited September 8, 2014 by mossman

Am I missing something with the KWright Flyer? Seems that node doesn't have any actual propulsion parts... the first Firespitter propellers are in the next node.

Why hasn't anyone else mentioned this?

That's odd, I think something must have gone wrong with your load. Can't imagine what.

I've also noticed that FAR doesn't play well with Firespitter, resulting in biplanes easily breaking the sound barrier.

I'd very much like a flight-first tech tree that doesn't rely on Firespitter.

I have had several people tell me the same thing about the "KWright Flyer". I will make it a parallel node instead of in the main aerospace tree. I've talked to the developer of Firespitter about the very same thing. He didn't like it either. He suggested some tweaking of the parts may need to be done to break at high speed but hasn't implemented it yet.

To answer Cpt. Kipard, a little bit of both much like the Interstellar integration.

I've also tried to implement AJE with no success. There is a resource conflict with the original Interstellar mod that causes KSP to crash. I will talk to Nathan about it when I get a chance.

Right now I am tweaking the nodes and spreading out the parts from different mods to blend them better into the tree as a whole. Also looking at better integrating the solid rockets to run parallel with their liquid fueled cousins as a lot of folks like the idea of starting with solids.

Edited September 13, 2014 by Probus
Definitely going to start using this once ATC updates. Looks absolutely awesome.
Yea me too. This is actually one of the first trees I've seen w/ MKS/OKS parts in it. Hopefully KSPI is added too!

Definitely going to start using this once ATC updates. Looks absolutely awesome.

as I remember, ATC's new version works with .25 nicely.

as I remember, ATC's new version works with .25 nicely.

It doesn't support adding new nodes, only rearranging the stock 55.

Super-late edit: This seems to work properly with TechManager

Im liking this allot.

Request: Add Laztek Space X packs (Launch,History, and explorer)

Also the rest of the Umbrea Space Industries mods

Its not working with Tech Manager the nodes are not showing up corretctly

If you'd like something similar to this in stock, then go here and voice your support.

I am planning on continuing this Tech Tree and adding as many mods as possible. Been waiting on a good tech tree editor to resurface and it looks like a couple of really good ones are coming out of development! Look for an update shortly after .90 is released.

If you'd like something similar to this in stock, then go here and voice your support.

Ok done

I am planning on continuing this Tech Tree and adding as many mods as possible. Been waiting on a good tech tree editor to resurface and it looks like a couple of really good ones are coming out of development! Look for an update shortly after .90 is released.

This is a good Tree Editor and I am bug testing it rite now to help get it more stable it uses Tech Manager or ACT to load the tree. If you grab the older .2.2 you can convert a TreeLoader Tree to ACT then open it in the new .2.3

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98942-WIN-TED-KSP-Tech-Tree-Editor-v0-2-3-ALPHA-EARLY-TESTING
Thanks SheepDog. I am planning on releasing this with the end of experimentals for 1.0.

Thanks SheepDog. I am planning on releasing this with the end of experimentals for 1.0.

The time has come ! If you are still around

The time has come ! If you are still around

I'm still around MegaUZI and working on an update. Thanks for checking in.

So, no update? :C

This looks like an awesome tech tree; I've been looking for one that's a bit more sensible than Stock.

Hey Probus,

I know format is a huge problem with these kinds of things. Is there any manual work you need to do? If you can post an example of what format you need and what format you have, I might be able to regex it all into place in a couple minutes. Not sure if that's helpful, but let me know what I can do
